text: James "Jim" McAnearney (20 March 1935 â€“ 14 March 2017) was a Scottish football player and manager. McAnearney played for Sheffield Wednesday, Plymouth Argyle, Watford and Bradford City, who he also briefly managed in 1968 with Tom Hallett. He later managed Rotherham United, Frickley Athletic, Scarborough and Hallam, and worked as a coach at Sheffield Wednesday (where he was also caretaker manager) and Leeds United. In later life he established and ran a tool/engineering business. McAnearney died on 14 March 2017, at the age of 81. ==References== ==Sources== * Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Footballers from Dundee Category:Plymouth Argyle F.C. players Category:Scottish football managers Category:Sheffield Wednesday F.C. players Category:Watford F.C. players
title: Jim McAnearney
